text: It’s very dark in here. Virtually the only thing we can m out is a double bed with a couple slumbering beneath a du Beside the bed, a Blackberry thrums into life, on vibrate From the bed, a man’s hand blearily reaches for the Blackberry, but manages instead to knock it onto the carp where it continues to thrum away. He grunts slightly. The Blackberry stops humming. For a moment, all is quiet agai Then another phone rings: an office desk phone, beside th bed. Sighing, he reaches over and switches on a lamp. Now see him: Michael Callow: early forties. His wife Jane rol over, pulls the covers up around her. Glancing at the clock beside the bed (5.13am), Michael li the receiver with a faintly resigned, apprehensive air.
Hello. He listens.
Just tell me what’s happened. He listens. Whoever’s on the phone is saying something, b not giving him the basics: what is happening?
What is it? The voice on the other end says something. Something that wakes him up. His face drains of what little colour the n had left it with.
I'll be right down. He hangs up and sits, slightly stunned, for a moment. Jan has woken up herself. She touches his arm to comfort him.
What’s happened?
(staring into space) Susannah.
Susannah?
Princess Susannah. He rips back the bedclothes and reaches for a dressing go Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Is she alright? Michael heads for the door.
I don’t know. INT. DOWNING STREET BRIEFING ROOM — NIGHT 2

A large oak panelled room. Prime Minister Michael Callow at a large conference room table, a coffee in front of hi still in his dressing gown. We hear muted sobs. Female. Coming from a speaker. But fo now, we’re watching the people in this room. It’s a COBRA meeting. Aside from Michael there are four others present Sitting to his right: Alex Cairns, Home Secretary, in her early 50s, smartly dressed. Also present: Julian Hereford of MI5 -- also smartly dressed. Standing at the back of the room, Director of Communicati Tom Bilce, in trendy specs. There’s also a steely looking man in his mid-30s: Section Chief Walker, also MI5, standing by a plasma screen which currently demanding everyone’s attention. The screen from which the sobs are emanating. It’s hooked up to a laptop front of Julian. On screen, an attractive woman in her 20s. Mascara runnin down her face. Cut-glass accent. We only see her from the shoulders up: straps of a summer dress and fresh bruises. It’s Princess Susannah. Clearly in great distress. Tied i position, arms behind her back as far as we can tell. She looks off to the side: there’s someone standing there, be the lens. Someone we can’t see.
Don’t kill me. We see Michael’s ashen face, as he watches. Then back to screen as an electronic voice - one of the standard ones included with modern laptops - speaks, off-mic, to the Princess.
Read the statement.
Please don’t kill me.
Read the statement. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Yes... all right. From that screen? There is a slight pause: we hear brief typing.
That is correct. Susannah looks down the lens, and starts to read, like an amateur presenter having to read an autocue at gunpoint. times hesitant... at times stuttering on her own terror.
I am Susannah, Duchess of Beaumont... popularly known as Princess Susannah. I am somewhere you cannot find, held by someone you will not trace. She pauses, peers at the next bit.
Prime Minister Michael Callow... We see Michael blanche at the direct mention of his name.

Prime Minister Michael Callow... My life... my life depends on you. If you do not do precisely as instructed by 4pm this afternoon, I will be... (she sobs) I will be executed. Oh God I c-- Abruptly, Julian taps the spacebar on the laptop -- the v pauses. *
What are you doing? Keep it going.

Prime Minister, at this point it’s important to say we are 100 percent certain this is indeed Princess Susannah. Her car was intercepted shortly after midnight. Returning from the wedding of one of her student friends. MICHAEL opens his mouth -- Alex Cairns speaks for the fir time. She’s looking down though, at the table. *
She'd insisted on going.
(to JULIAN) But you had security on her, I mean- Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Two PPOs; still unconscious.
Unconscious?
Heavy sedative, close range, each with a single puncture wound, no sign of struggle. Michael gestures at the screen, dazed.
What do they want, money? No-one says anything. Beat.
Release a jihadi? Scrap 3rd world debt? (exasperated by silence) Save the fucking libraries?
We believe both the video and the demand it contains to be genuine.
(shouting) What demand?

What Susannah says next... it concerns you directly sir. Michael stares at her. Looks round at all of them. None his aides are making eye contact. He’s worked alongside A and Tom for three years. Now they won’t look at him. Julian is also looking at the table. This already bad situation just took a lurch towards nightmarish. Callow looks at Walker, who is regarding him with a glimmer of sympathy.
This is actually happening sir.
(quieter) Just play it. Julian hits his keyboard. The video resumes. of Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
«-. can’t... please... I don’t want to die. She dissolves into sobs. We hear fast off-camera typing.
Continue to read the statement. Susannah looks back at the lens.

There is only one demand. And it is a simple one. At 4pm this afternoon Prime Minister Michael Callow must appear on live television, on all British networks -- terrestrial and satellite -- and... no.
Continue to read the statement --

«+. on all British networks, terrestrial and satellite -- and have full unsimulated sexual intercourse with a pig. (sob; looks offscreen) I don’t understand. Julian pauses the recording again, just as a list of instructions appears.

The video ends with a series of technical specifications for the broadcast. We watch MICHAEL’s face register 500 bewilderments at onc He tries to speak. Nothing. He almost laughs. Then thinks again. He looks around: no-one makes eye contact. Finally
Why are you doing this? (beat) It’s a joke, right? Ha ha Mike. Ho ho. There is more silence.
It’s real. Michael stares at the table. Then back at the screen. The Alex, his confidant.
Did she say “pig”? Sex with a pig. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2 Alex nods.
They want me to have sex with a pig?
On live television this afternoon.
But what -- who the--
We're checking with our embedded operatives, compiling suspects as we speak.
Meanwhile, the demand has been made and there’s not long to formulate our response.
Well I’m not fucking a pig. Page one, that’s not happening.
Of course. He looks around. Alex nods. Tom nods. Julian nods. Walker face doesn’t react at first. Until Michael looks at him.
Absolutely sir.
(to Julian) Have we established a dialogue with this... person?
We can’t. There’s no email address, no codeword, no channel for negotiation. Almost certainly a deliberate stance. Michael stands up again. He’s pacing now, trying to think
Okay. So. We focus on finding Susannah, get her back, however it’s done, I don’t care, we stop this now.
I assure you everyone is working toward this. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Yes -- no! Not everyone! Dedicated core team. This can’t go wide. He looks at Tom Bilce.
And keep it so far from the press it’s on the other side of Jupiter. Tom opens his mouth awkwardly.
It only exists in this room.
It’s already outside it. That’s another blow. Michael’s rattled by it:
If there's hacks sniffing round, shut them down. Tom looks like he wants to say something.
Bright red D-notice. Super-fucking- Godzilla-injunction with ten-inch Whitehall fangs. Before Tom can answer, Julian interjects.
This video came from YouTube. Michael spins around, agape.
What?
It was uploaded via an encrypted IP over an hour ago.
Well get it off there!
We did, after nine minutes. But that was long enough for it to be downloaded, duplicated, and spread.
Spread? How many people have seen this? Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
We take one down, six clones pop up elsewhere. It’s viral.
How many people?
50,000. That’s our current estimate. Michael is silenced as that unfurls in his head. Then:
The newsrooms have got it.
(alarm) They're running this on air?
No. We put a type five D-notice out immediately, and they’re complying.
For now. Michael’s spooked. Alex shoots Tom a look: not helpful.
(ominously) It’s trending on Twitter. Michael looks at the screen, once again struck dumb. He l around the room; he might cry. Then he thumps the table h
(calmly) Well, yes.
So now what? What’s the playbook?
It’s new territory, Prime Minister. There is no playbook. Michael looks more puce than ever. Rubs his eyes.
Christ.
Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
A flat above a shop. We close in on a bedroom window. INT. KIERAN & LAUREN’S BEDROOM - DAY 1. EARLY MORNING 4

This is a bedroom belonging to a young couple. The male half, Kieran, sleeps in bed. His girlfriend Laur isn’t here yet. The door bursts open. It’s Lauren his girlfriend, dressed work -- she works as a receptionist in A&E. She’s holding laptop and a phone. Kieran jumps.
Princess Susannah’s been kidnapped!
You scared the shit out of me.
There’s a YouTube of it!
(half awake) Go to work...

Gabriel texted me about it from Canada. LAUREN passes him the laptop and then switches on the TV. We look over Kieran’s shoulder at the laptop. The video - beneath it are comments from viewers -- a lot of ‘WIF’ an ‘OMFG’.
(oov) On all major networks... terrestrial and satellite -- and have full unsimulated sexual intercourse with a pig.
Gotta be a pisstake.

(eyes on the TV) It’s too... weird for that. Lauren is watching the channel UKN News -- a news network LUCINDA TOWNE is the NEWSREADER Archive footage of fire engines and the headline NO WAY O Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
«+. the Tillsdale fire inquiry hears harrowing 999 calls made by trapped residents as flames engulfed the building.
Why’s it not on the news?
It’s early morning. We’re looking at a glass-and-steel building. A bit Horseferry Road. A sign with a big UKN Ne logo. Over this, we hear a woman’s voice. The newsreader.
Shut Down: The Tate Modern's controversial '‘Agitation' exhibition closes three weeks ahead of schedule, amidst criticism from the Culture Secretary.
A modern rolling news studio. From one side of the camera see morning shift news anchor Lucinda Towne reading headlines.
In the Clear: Footballer Geraint Fitch has been cleared of any wrongdoing following a confrontation with the paparazzi outside a Manchester restaurant.

This is a meeting room designed to accommodate about twel people comfortably. Right now it’s holding almost double that, some seated round the table, some standing. On the table a laptop shows the Princess Susannah video. A debate is in full flow. Doing most of the talking are: reporters, Malaika (female, attractive, late 20s) and Dam (late 30s). Outranking them are Shelly, Day Editor (late and Martin, Executive Editor (early 40s). Martin sits at head of the table.
How would we even describe it? An “indecent act”? +e * HF
Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Everyone’s seen the video; they already know the full--
If we mentioned bestiality pre- watershed Ofcom’d be seriously pissed off--
(snorting) Fuck Ofcom.
We’re still honouring the D-notice -
But surel--
(raised voice) We are honouring the D-notice
(sotto) The voluntary D-notice...
(looking at Malaika) It may be a ‘sportsman-like gesture’ but we’re making it. (he looks around) A woman's life’s at stake. We follow procedure. Malaika holds up her iPhone to display Tweetdeck.
(brandishing iPhone) My timeline consists 100 percent of viewers asking why we’re not covering it. How do I reply?
You don’t.
That’s totally backwards--
No-one’s breaking rank. Not the Beeb, not Sky, not --
(unhelpfully) I hear Facebook's coverage is pretty comprehensive. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
That may be, but --
It’s like 9/11’s happening and we’re broadcasting sandwich recipes.
We are not a chatroom. A young researcher, JACK, sticks his head round the door.
It’s on CNN. The room turns to look at him.
And Fox. And MSNBC. Al Jazeera, NHK, NDTV...
(he’s got the point) Alright. Malaika looks vindicated. Martin crumples slightly.
(sighing) This planet. Then he claps his hands and stands up -- a commander.

Okay. Sarah, you cover the snatch itself. Damon, public reaction; Mira, Royal angle, upcoming marriage etc; Simon -- set tone with standards and practices. We’ve got to explain this without viewers sicking up their Weetabix. Martin walks past a series of team members; he’s like Pat But he’s ignoring Malaika, and she’s starting to notice.
Lorcan, the internet aspect. New paradigm, Twitter, Arab spring, all that bibble. Lorcan nods. Martin is already onto the man beside him.
Dan, all graphics run past me. And keep it functional. No Peppa pigs. Finally he gets to Malaika. A brief pause. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Malaika, update the Princess obit VT. Wow. To Malaika, that’s an insult.
The obit VT. Finally Martin looks at Shelly. He puts his hand on her shoulder.
Shelly -- you're fired. Shelly looks aghast.
Seriously, get out. Shelly goes to open her mouth.

(deadpan) Okay that was a lie. I'll be in the gallery with you, if you can bear that. (sighing) But first... an awkward phonecall. Least I can do is warn Tom. As MARTIN exits the room, we see MALAIKA is texting someo

A twenty-something press assistant called ANDREW is glanc at an incoming message on his Blackberry -- we don’t see but then quickly hurries off screen, as he hears, bombing round the corner, Tom Bilce on the phone. Tom looks furio but daren’t raise his voice too much.
We put a D-notice on it!
(on phone) It’s global, Tom.
Don’t. I’m begging you.
(on phone) You're begging me?
Don’t run it Martin.
+ eH Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
(on phone) I’m sorry: I can’t help you Tom. Two Downing Street staff members brush past Tom; he nods one, lowers his voice further. Once they’re out of earsho he hisses violently into the mouthpiece.

(furious, hissing) Know how much help you're getting from here on in? Multiply nothing by shit all. UKN’s dead to us. Shove it up your arse you f-- Just then the door he’s standing beside opens -- Alex app in it. Tom abruptly hangs up. Alex eyes Tom with suspicio
(pointing at phone) Interesting?
A man.
A man?
A man. Beat.
(quietish) Tom, so you’re across it... I’m exploring contingency plans. Tom gives her a look.
A TV Studios. But there’s something strange about it: specifically, we see, a police officer near the door, tur a member of staff away.

On the walls: the occasional framed shot of celebs and gameshows. This place is commonly used for mainstream TV. A besuited special agent named CALLETT -- Government type about 35, is on the move toward the studio, flanked by tw armed special officers. They pass a corridor -- CALLETT quickly points down it. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2

Harper, any doors down there, secure them. One of the officers obediently peels off to stride down t corridor. CALLETT and the remaining officer keep moving. A paunchy producer in his mid-40s called JON appears from another corridor, chaperoning NOEL, a youngish FX guy wit flashy Alienware laptop under his arm.
Mr. Callett? Noel from Blue Eye. With a glance, CALLETT sizes him up. Noel is about 24; a alternative, in a T-shirt with retro videogame art on it.
(quickly) Noel won an Emmy for his FX work on that HBO moon... western... thing.
Sea of Tranquility.
You won't find better. By now they’re at the perimeter of a TV studio, walking backstage... CALLETT still walking with purpose.
(to NOEL) Can you map a head onto a different body, live?
Depends if your camera’s moving. Callett hands him a print-out with a list of rules on it
His rule-sheet specifies a single * handheld camera in a constant * ‘roving’ motion. * Noel inspects the list. As he reads it, we start moving i the studio space itself...
They enter a cavernous television studio more commonly us for gameshows. Today it’s stark. A simple black backdrop.
Gonzo style. * (reading) * (MORE)
Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2 14
Knows his shit, that’s tough. (back to the list) “Fruition” to be transmitted in full? What’s -- (thinks for a moment; answers own thought) Ah. Yeah.
Just focus on the visuals. Different face mapped onto a live... (not sure of the word) performer... with those stipulations.
Fringes of possibility...
Deadline’s at four. Need to know if it’s workable by two.
Can’t happen.
It has to. Any kit you need -- any kit, it’s yours.
Mate, I’m good, but I’m not Jesus Christ. As CALLETT walks off; not even looking back at NOEL...
He didn’t have computers.
This is a Casualty waiting area with seating, a reception desk, and a plasma TV on the wall near the Reception Desk keep waiting patients occupied. + eH

Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2 The plasma TV is tuned to UKN News, upon which Lucinda To is still blahing on about anything other than this. Foota of BIN COLLECTION VAN and headline REFUSE ROW. A slim nurse, BRIAN, is near the desk. Also an orderly, P (boorish guy in ironic T-shirt). They’re both looking at telly. LAUREN arrives and takes her place behind the desk
Is it still not on telly?
Nothing. Must be a hoax.
Or a blackout. Just then, the onscreen strap is replaced by a whooshing BREAKING NEWS logo.
Woah, heads up.
(shift in tone to suggest this is potentially monumentally upsetting news for most viewers) Some major breaking news now here on UKN.
(shouting back to some other staff) It’s real! Everyone else in the area looks up. Now it’s real.
Full screen on the news report. The BIG BREAKING NEWS STR resolves to PRINCESS KIDNAPPED Beneath that in smaller te Susannah Duchess of Beaumont has been kidnapped.

head_text.subj: NB TEXT IN BOLD ITALICS WILL BE WHAT IS HEARD IN THE

text: In the last few minutes it's been confirmed that Susannah, Duchess of Beaumont has been kidnapped. A video uploaded anonymously to the internet appears to depict the Princess pleading for her life. STILLS FROM THE VIDEO; PRINCESS KIDNAPPED strap stays up.
eH HH FH *
Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2 16
INT. KIERAN & LAUREN’S BEDROOM - DAY 1 16A
KIERAN is now sitting up, watching the TV.
(on screen) In the video, The Princess is depicted pleading for her life and addressing Prime Minister Michael Callow directly.
Everyone is rapt with attention. Patients and staff alike

Details regarding the kidnap itself are scarce, although UKN understands the vehicle the Princess was travelling in was intercepted shortly after lam this morning. This is a scene being played out across the country.
This is a pub; not open yet but they’re preparing for the day. A DELIVERY MAN is wheeling in barrels of lager as a woman who works in the pub watches the news on a small portable TV near the bar.

The identity of the group or individual thought to be holding the Princess is unknown although its understood the Security Services are currently following every available lead. We also see, in the UKN video, some news photos of the Princess -- in one her Emerald engagement ring is feature prominently.
eee
+ eH
+e % Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2 19 20 21
Some kind of workshop, in which a man in paint-spattered overalls has stopped to watch a small TV in the backgroun He drinks a cup of coffee while watching the broadcast.

As police round up potential suspects across the nation this UKN News viewer video shows armed officers raiding an address in Bradford. A man thought to be connected with a religious pressure group can be seen being dragged to a waiting van.
On the screen: shaky iPhone-quality video footage of guys being bundled into the back of a van by armed cops (OR VA SIMPLY OUTSIDE AN ADDRESS).

Michael is doing up a shirt - he’s just got changed. Walk passes him a sheet of paper containing a list of names. S are organizations -- from Animal Rights to Muslims4Sharia others are named individuals.
Our embeds have ruled out the major players: it’s not AQ, not IRA. This is what’s left. Radicals, hate groups, people who’ve threatened yourself or the Royals...
They're being brought in as we speak.
For more than questioning I hope. (looking at list) Someone knows something.
In the casualty area they’re still transfixed by the brea news.
(on screen) Two guards in the princess's security detail were reportedly rendered unconscious during the kidnap. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
(eating a biscuit) If it’s terrorists they’1l take her head off.
Fuck sake, man.
Just saying.

SONIA, a barmaid-landlady in her early thirties, is behin the bar, preparing pumps for the day’s trade and being distracted by a portable TV in the corner on which the ne is being broadcast. Behind her, her faintly nerdy 13-year mixed race son has wandered downstairs and is half-watchi the news, half-playing a handheld videogame.
The video also depicts the Princess * reciting a statement containing a * bizarre ransom demand of a personal * nature involving the Prime * Minister. *
(eyes on TV) They'll be asking for a million quid or something.
(gawping at game) They want him to do it with a pig.
(annoyed by that) Go to school. The boy exits. *

TOM BILCE bustles toward his office, Blackberry beeping e few seconds. Beside him, a young assistant called CAMILLA referring to an iPad, updates him on coverage so far. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2 25

Telegraph has the full video and an interactive timeline, tonally stark, brief mention of ransom being a sex act, nothing too gross... They near the press office... INT. DOWNING STREET PRESS OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER. DAY 1.
This is Tom Bilce’s little fiefdom. Computer monitors, an two big tellies at the side. One is tuned to UKN News. TOM and CAMILLA enter.

The Sun’s site runs with ‘TAKEN’; big grab of Susannah, mentions the demand euphemistically... It’s a poky room, with desks, and three young assistants their twenties. One of whom is the quiet, faintly nerdy assistant called ANDREW we saw in a corridor earlier. He’ currently on the phone, speaking slightly in code.
(on phone) Of course I still want that drink.
We see it’s MALAIKA on the phone.
(on phone) Then give me something...
ANDREW’s worried he might be overheard
It’s not - that won't be possible We watch Tom's face, staring intently at the TV as CAMILL continues with her coverage assessment.
(on phone) I'm friendly when I drink. Very friendly when I’m grateful.
+ eH Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Want to see how grateful I can be? 25B INT. DOWNING STREET PRESS OFFICE - CONTINUOUS. DAY 1.
ANDREW turns the phone to his other ear and lowers his vo
There’s no comment at this time. He hangs up.
MALAIKA looks at her phone and thinks.
Malaika has slid the sides of her top down slightly, to expose her shoulders. She is taking a photo of herself wi her phone. She looks at it and hits some more keys.
Camilla is still burbling away while Tom gawps at UKN New
Guardian's businesslike but sympathetic; they are running a * fucking liveblog -- *
Ugh. *

«+. and a short think piece on * historical symbolism of the pig... * Andrew's Blackberry thrums once more. He looks at it. A picture of Malaika -- cut off just below the shoulders. I looks like she’s naked, even though she isn’t. He checks no-one’s looking over his shoulder. Looks at th photo again. And he puts the phone back in his pocket. Bu now he’s on a slightly different plane, somehow.
Jane, with a worried expression on her face, moving down the flat towards the briefing room. * Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Outside the briefing room door, a security guard, spots J and looks at the floor.
This is now a nerve centre. Staff coming and going -- the in shirt pacing up and down. Julian updating him...

We've been squeezing hard but still nothing concrete. Those names were long shots, so maybe no surprise b-- A commotion; someone trying to enter. A security guard tr to stop them. It’s Jane. We hear but don’t see her.
(oov) It’s my house. You can’t stop me. That's my doorway. You're touching my doorhandle. Jane pushes past the security guy. Everyone’s looking at Then at their shoes. Jane fixes Michael with a look.
(sharply) Can I have a word? Michael opens his mouth. But nothing comes out. 29A INT. DOWNING STREET CORRIDOR - MOMENTS LATER. DAY 1. A staff member shuts the briefing room doors from outside
The briefing room is now empty apart from the PM and JANE
It won’t come to that.
And if they don’t find her?
MI5 have a name; they’re surrounding a place now.
Where? Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
What?
Where’s the place?
(impressively fast) Truro.
(equally impressive) Why are you lying?
What?
You're lying. Truro, Jesus. No point arguing. He puts a hand on her shoulder.
I don’t want you worrying--
(pushing his arm away) You never patronize me, don’t start now.
Whoever this is is insane--
-- and has a princess --
Who'll get through this --
Not any princess, but the princess--
Even if they don’t find him --
- Princess Facebook bloody eco- conscious ‘national sweetheart’ ...
-- I won't have to do anything.
(tearing up) Everyone’s laughing at us.
You don’t know that. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
I know ‘people’. We love humiliation. It’s just slapstick to us -- we can’t not laugh.
Nothing’s going to happen --
It’s already happening in their heads. In their heads, that’s what you're doing, what my husband's doing... He touches her neck; she pushes his hand away. He touches again. His touch makes her cry.
I just... please... She pushes his hand away, but doesn’t really want to. He it back, cradling her head.
Jane...
I love you. There’s a knock at the door. Then it opens to reveal CAMI
(irritated) What?
Palace on the phone sir.
I’ll be there in a bit. Get Alex to stall them.
She's been speaking to her for the last ten minutes.
Her?
It’s the Queen herself. Michael looks at Jane as if to say ‘sorry, but...’.
(understandingly) Go on. Jane masks her tears from CAMILLA as she leaves. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2

We are listening to a radio phone-in over shots of traffi shots of builders on a site (with a radio); shots of a wo listening in her garden. The host is BOB HAYNES. The first caller is a man called WAROUQ who speaks with a bit of an ‘innit’ tone.
So Waroug: you say no negotiation with terrorists?
(phone static) Yeah, cos if he did it, right, what next? Someone says we’ll set off a dirty bomb unless Obama does a shit-
Sorry Warouq, got to cut you off there, apologies for the language ladies and gentlemen; now on line three it’s Sam, hi Sam...

Callett is surveying the scene in front of him. Jon is standing still in position behind someone else who is on fours, as though mimicking a pig. NB no ‘thrusting’ motio On the other side of the studio is a man standing roughly position against a large sheet of green fabric. CALLET stands behind Noel -- upon Noel’s laptop we see an image of Jon with the other man’s head mapped onto it.
Confident?
Bit of a kick bollock scramble but with finessing it should work.
Then finesse quickly. Our ‘performer’ is on his way. Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2

An official-looking car pulls to a halt outside the TV complex. A waiting officer opens the rear door. Out steps humourless besuited civil servant called BROWNE, closely followed by a rather goonish-looking lanky man in his ear forties, with longish hair and a gold necklace. He’s Colin Flynn, better known by his ‘screen name’ ROD SENSELESS. A porn star ala Ben Dover, in mid-conversation with BROWNE. A one-sided talk: BROWNE is trying to ignore him.
It’s a new one for me, obviously, cos it’s illegal. I wouldn’t normally, y'know. Have you seen my stuff?
No.
Well I’m pretty trad. Bish bash bosh. I’d say no fannying about, but I'd be lying. That usually gets a laugh. Not now.
Yeah, well. What do I put on the invoice, that’s what I’m wondering?
(trying not to sigh) There won't be any invoicing. During this last exchange, a SPARK unloading equipment fr his truck spots Rod, and holds up a cameraphone.
Oy oy Rod! Rod does a cheeky thumbs up as the spark take a snap -- BROWNE impatiently hurries him toward the entrance. The pedestrian walks off, fiddling with his phone...
Black Mirror 'The National Anthem' - Pink Script - 1/8/2
Full screen on UKN as Lucinda Towne chairs a debate betwe MEHDI RAHBOUD, a surprisingly youthful professor of Middl Eastern Studies and SIR HAROLD MOUNT, former counter- terrorism head.
I can't think of anything even remotely similar to this - it's an entirely new form of terrorism (the point of which I can't begin to understand)
If this is terrorism it's not Islamist in nature. To request a pig is -- (specifically abhorrent to)
